Articles.Content:
On all my parts I get a solid black line where the two ends of the Texture meet.

Just wondering what I can do to solve this.

I\'ve made sure it\'s not an issue with my Texture image. It\'s all white and completely covers all of the UV layout.

Sometimes the exported UVMap template is just imprecise enough to leave a gap, when you\'re wrapping a texture like that, just paint it a little larger than the template shows (and for the same reason, dont put the different \'islands\' too close together.

I\'ve tried that before to no avail. I\'ll give it another go though because I\'ve changed the UV layout several times since I first noticed it

Yep that worked. I had the same issue with another part too. Looks like the UV Layout is on the very lefthand edge of the .png and KSP actually pulls 2 pixel columns off the far right hand side of the .png

Never would have guessed
